subject: Productivity
title: The Printing Press Revolution
description: One-minute skill: The Printing Press Revolution.

hook.text: Before Gutenberg, copying a book took a monk months. The printing press did it in days.

buildup.text: Johannes Gutenberg introduced movable type around 1440. Knowledge production exploded.

discovery.text: Within 50 years, over 20 million books were printed. Literacy and learning spread across Europe.

twist.text: The press didn't just multiply books. It standardized spelling, grammar, and even thought.

climax.text: Gutenberg's real invention wasn't a machine. It was scalable knowledge transfer.

punchline.text: One press replaced a thousand monks.

quiz.question: How many books were printed within 50 years of Gutenberg's press?
